record.title: MORNING BUSINESS

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to a period for the transaction of morning business, with Senators allowed to speak for up to 10 minutes each.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. WHITEHOUSE.) Without objection, it is so ordered.
I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, is the Senate in morning business?
I ask to speak--it will not be for a very long time but longer than the usual 10 minutes allotted.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The Senator from Iowa is recognized.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Mr. GRASSLEY pertaining to the introduction of S. 2041 are printed in today's Record under "Statements on Introduced Bills and Joint Resolutions.")

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I yield the floor, and I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
